intro: Veronica longifolia subsp. septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern speedwell, is a flowering plant native to northern regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm, featuring dense clusters of small, blue to violet flowers. The plant has slender, spreading stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky areas. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
